text: So, responsive price action is not as aggressive as initiative price action.
In fact, responsive is where the buyers and sellers respond to higher or lower prices
being advertised.
Now, a good example to look at is the one in the chart provided.

from sellers. In other words, sellers get brought into the game or they respond to the
higher prices. Equally, when the price is advertised toward the support area, we again
see buyers responding to lower prices being advertised.
Now on the flip side, remember, we said initiative is very aggressive. The order type is very

passive order type. So in a downward pricing initiative taken by sellers, there are buyers

So what you will come to notice, and you should have already noticed, is that most of the
time in the markets over a period of a day, most of the time is spent with responsive
type price action.
It's very, very rare, you know, that most days you'll find that there's one or two

Now initiative and responsive price action are two types of auction process that occur
